trans-unit.source: OData support
trans-unit.target: OData support

trans-unit.source: Support for OData (Azure Search)
trans-unit.target: Support for OData (Azure Search)

trans-unit.source: Azure Search service API uses Open Data Protocol (OData) for index queries.
trans-unit.target: Azure Search service API uses Open Data Protocol (OData) for index queries.

trans-unit.source: Azure Search supports OData version 4.
trans-unit.target: Azure Search supports OData version 4.

trans-unit.source: OData syntax in HTTP request headers
trans-unit.target: OData syntax in HTTP request headers

trans-unit.source: OData defines a few HTTP request headers that you can optionally set.
trans-unit.target: OData defines a few HTTP request headers that you can optionally set.

trans-unit.source: You can use OData-specific values for the Accept header like <codeInline>application/json;odata.metadata=none</codeInline> to control the amount of metadata included in the response.
trans-unit.target: You can use OData-specific values for the Accept header like <codeInline>application/json;odata.metadata=none</codeInline> to control the amount of metadata included in the response.

trans-unit.source: The default is <codeInline>odata.metadata=minimal</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: The default is <codeInline>odata.metadata=minimal</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: For brevity, all examples in this document assume <codeInline>odata.metadata=none</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: For brevity, all examples in this document assume <codeInline>odata.metadata=none</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: Another header you can set is <codeInline>OData-MaxVersion</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: Another header you can set is <codeInline>OData-MaxVersion</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: The Azure Search Service API supports OData V4 so you should set <codeInline>OData-MaxVersion</codeInline> to "4.0".
trans-unit.target: The Azure Search Service API supports OData V4 so you should set <codeInline>OData-MaxVersion</codeInline> to "4.0".

trans-unit.source: This tells the API to expect the OData V4 format in the request body, and to send responses in the OData V4 format.
trans-unit.target: This tells the API to expect the OData V4 format in the request body, and to send responses in the OData V4 format.

trans-unit.source: In the future as we add support for newer versions of the OData protocol, you may set this header to a different value.
trans-unit.target: In the future as we add support for newer versions of the OData protocol, you may set this header to a different value.

trans-unit.source: The Azure Search service API does not support versions of OData older than V4.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Search service API does not support versions of OData older than V4.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="20217801-f1f7-49e2-badf-0ac356bf8975" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">OData Expression Syntax for Azure Search</link> for details about using OData syntax when querying an index.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="20217801-f1f7-49e2-badf-0ac356bf8975" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">OData Expression Syntax for Azure Search</link> for details about using OData syntax when querying an index.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="1d656013-e580-4762-9ea1-8aa5d0e96ac2" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Simple query syntax in Azure Search</link> for alternative syntax.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="1d656013-e580-4762-9ea1-8aa5d0e96ac2" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Simple query syntax in Azure Search</link> for alternative syntax.

trans-unit.source: Search service API with Alternate OData syntax
trans-unit.target: Search service API with Alternate OData syntax

trans-unit.source: The Search service API supports OData syntax for entity lookup.
trans-unit.target: The Search service API supports OData syntax for entity lookup.

trans-unit.source: This applies both to both documents in an index, as well as to indexes themselves (where the index name is the entity key).
trans-unit.target: This applies both to both documents in an index, as well as to indexes themselves (where the index name is the entity key).

trans-unit.source: Here is a summary of all APIs that have alternate OData syntax:
trans-unit.target: Here is a summary of all APIs that have alternate OData syntax:
